result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mariah J Berger

records.addlTxt: 1:30 p.m.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Atty Richards appears for def who also appears via Zoom.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for WOPH today.  Def approves of hrg via Zoom.  Court explains purpose of prelim.  Def understands and is still willing to waive prelim.  Def is satisfied with rep. by atty.  Atty Richards agrees def knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waives.  Court finds def knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently pleads.  Court accepts WOPH, BOT.  Info to mirror complaint per DA.  One count of forgery.  ARGN:  Def waives further reading of the Info (to be filed) and pleads NG.  PTC to be set for 8/10 at 9:30 a.m. Adj.  1:36 p.m.  klr
Waiver of Prelim on July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:44 a.m.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew J Tingstad in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Mariah J Berger. Case was set for prelim today.  Def had medical emergency.  Court informed there is going to be a WOPH.  7/27 at 1:30 for WOPH and ARGN.  Date can be used also as PLEAS if parties are at that point.  Adj.  9:44 a.m.  klr

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

9:07 A.M.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Def appears via Zoom.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Right to atty explained.  PD contact info given to def.  DA requests $2,500 sig bond.  Court explains bond to def.  To be mailed.  New address provided.  Case to be scheduled.  Bond to be mailed.  Adj.  9:10 a.m.  klr
Initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
10:49 a.m.  Court calls case.  Cites appearances.  Def FTA.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  DA requests case be reset to 6/27 at 9:00 a.m.  Adj.  10:50 a.m.  klr
